pageContext.claim: “'Gas prices drop across the United States because President Trump has deregulated Energy and we are now  producing a great deal more oil than ever before.' @foxandfriends  But this is bad news for Russia, why would President Trump do such a thing? Thought he worked for Kremlin?”
pageContext.analysis: Trump tweets a claim that gives him far too much credit for the decline in gasoline prices. The president has little power to move prices at the gas pump in any direction because they depend on market forces beyond his control. A variety of market factors has contributed to the falling price of oil. While the decline might not be good for Russia, this was not the result of administration policy.
